Part 6 How does COVID - 19 spread ? People can catch COVID - 19 from others who have the virus . The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID - 19 coughs or exhales . #FREDIBOAT Part 10 Can CoVID - 19 be caught from a person who has no symptoms ? The main way the disease spreads is through respiratory droplets expelled by someone who is coughing . The risk of catching COVID - 19 from someone with no symptoms at all is very low . However , #FREDIBOAT Part 11 many people with COVID - 19 experience only mild symptoms . This is particularly true at the early stages of the disease . It is therefore possible to catch COVID - 19 from someone who has , for example , just a mild cough and does not feel ill . #FREDIBOAT Part 12 WHO is assessing ongoing research on the period of transmission of COVID - 19 and will continue to share updated findings . #FREDIBOAT Part 13 Can I catch COVID - 19 from the feces of someone with the disease ? The risk of catching COVID - 19 from the feces of an infected person appears to be low . While initial investigations suggest the virus may be present in feces in some cases , spread through this #FREDIBOAT Part 14 route is not a main feature of the outbreak . WHO is assessing ongoing research on the ways COVID - 19 is spread and will continue to share new findings . #FREDIBOAT Part 15 Because this is a risk , however , it is another reason to clean hands regularly , after using the bathroom and before eating #FREDIBOAT Part 16 What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease ? Protection measures for everyone Stay aware of the latest information on the COVID - 19 outbreak , available on the WHO website and through your national and local public health authority . #FREDIBOAT Part 17 Many countries around the world have seen cases of COVID - 19 and several have seen outbreaks . Authorities in China and some other countries have succeeded in slowing or stopping their outbreaks . However , the situation is unpredictable so check regularly #FREDIBOAT for the latest news . Part 18 You can reduce your chances of being infected or spreading COVID - 19 by taking some simple precautions : Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water . Why ? Washing your hands with #FREDIBOAT Part 20 surfaces and can pick up viruses . Once contaminated , hands can transfer the virus to your eyes , nose or mouth . From there , the virus can enter your body and can make you sick . Make sure you , and the people around you , follow good respiratory hygiene . #FREDIBOAT Part 21 This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze . Then dispose of the used tissue immediately . Why ? Droplets spread virus . By following good respiratory hygiene you protect the people around you from viruses such as Part 22 cold , flu and COVID - 19 . Stay home if you feel unwell . If you have a fever , cough and difficulty breathing , seek medical attention and call in advance . Follow the directions of your local health authority . Why ? National and local authorities will #FREDIBOAT Part 23 have the most up to date information on the situation in your area . Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility . This will also protect you and help prevent spread of viruses and other infections . #FREDIBOAT Part 24 Keep up to date on the latest COVID - 19 hotspots ( cities or local areas where COVID - 19 is spreading widely ) . If possible , avoid traveling to places – especially if you are an older person or have diabetes , heart or lung disease . Why ? #FREDIBOAT Part 25 You have a higher chance of catching COVID - 19 in one of these areas . * * * Protection measures for persons who are in or have recently visited ( past 14 days ) areas where COVID - 19 is spreading Follow the guidance outlined above ( Protection measures for #FREDIBOAT Part 26 everyone ) Self-isolate by staying at home if you begin to feel unwell , even with mild symptoms such as headache , low grade fever ( 37.3 C or above ) and slight runny nose , until you recover . If it is essential for you to have someone bring you supplies or #FREDIBOAT Part 27 to go out , e . g . to buy food , then wear a mask to avoid infecting other people . Why ? Avoiding contact with others and visits to medical facilities will allow these facilities to operate more effectively and help protect you and others from possible COVID - 19 #FREDIBOAT Part 28 Why ? Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility . This will also help to prevent possible spread of COVID - 19 and other viruses . #FREDIBOAT Part 29 How likely am I to catch COVID - 19 ? The risk depends on where you are - and more specifically , whether there is a COVID - 19 outbreak unfolding there . For most people in most locations the risk of catching COVID - 19 is still low . However , there are now places around Part 30 the world ( cities or areas ) where the disease is spreading . For people living in , or visiting , these areas the risk of catching COVID - 19 is higher . Governments and health authorities are taking vigorous action every time a new case of COVID - 19 is identified . Be sure to Part 31 comply with any local restrictions on travel , movement or large gatherings . Cooperating with disease control efforts will reduce your risk of catching or spreading COVID - 19 . COVID - 19 outbreaks can be contained and transmission stopped , as has been shown in #FREDIBOAT Part 32 China and some other countries . Unfortunately , new outbreaks can emerge rapidly . It 's important to be aware of the situation where you are or intend to go . WHO publishes daily updates on the COVID - 19 situation worldwide . You can see these at HTTPURL

Spraying such substances can be harmful to clothes or mucous membranes ( i . e . eyes , mouth ) . Be aware that both alcohol and chlorine can be useful to disinfect surfaces , but they need to be used under appropriate recommendations . HTTPURL Can eating garlic help prevent infection with the new coronavirus ? Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties . However , there is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus . HTTPURL Does the new coronavirus affect older people , or are younger people also susceptible ? People of all ages can be infected by the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) . Older people , and people with pre-existing medical conditions ( such as asthma , diabetes , heart disease ) appear to be more vulnerable to becoming severely ill with the virus . WHO advises people of all ages to take steps to protect themselves from the virus , for example by following good hand hygiene and good respiratory hygiene . HTTPURL Are antibiotics effective in preventing and treating the new coronavirus ? No , antibiotics do not work against viruses , only bacteria . The new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) is a virus and , therefore , antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment . However , if you are hospitalized for the 2019 - nCoV , you may receive antibiotics because bacterial co-infection is possible . HTTPURL Are there any specific medicines to prevent or treat the new coronavirus ? To date , there is no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) . However , those infected with the virus should receive appropriate care to relieve and treat symptoms , and those with severe illness should receive optimized supportive care . Some specific treatments are under investigation , and will be tested through clinical trials . WHO is helping to accelerate research and development efforts with a range or partners . Pls Do n't panic people with fake news because it 's not real All Facts are in these threads HTTPURL

Actually , taking a hot bath with extremely hot water can be harmful , as it can burn you . The best way to protect yourself against COVID - 19 is by frequently cleaning your hands . By doing this you eliminate viruses that may be on your hands and avoid infection . #Covid_19 6 / n MYTH - 04 : THE NEW CORONAVIRUS CAN BE TRANSMITTED THROUGH MOSQUITO BITES . To date , there has been no information nor evidence to suggest that the new coronavirus could be transmitted by mosquitoes . 7 / n MYTH - 05 : ARE HAND DRYERS EFFECTIVE IN KILLING THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? No . Hand dryers are not effective in killing the 2019 - nCoV . #Covid_19 8/ n MYTH - 06 : CAN AN ULTRAVIOLET DISINFECTION LAMP KILL THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? UV lamps should not be used to sterilize hands or other areas of skin as UV radiation can cause skin irritation . #Covid_19 9 / n MYTH - 07 : HOW EFFECTIVE ARE THERMAL SCANNERS IN DETECTING PEOPLE INFECTED WITH THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? Thermal scanners are effective in detecting people who have developed a fever ( i . e . have a higher than normal body temperature ) because of infection with the new coronavirus . 10 / n MYTH - 08 : CAN SPRAYING ALCOHOL OR CHLORINE ALL OVER YOUR BODY KILL THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? No . Spraying alcohol or chlorine all over your body will not kill viruses that have already entered your body . Spraying such substances can be harmful to clothes or mucous membranes . 11 / n MYTH - 09 : DO VACCINES AGAINST PNEUMONIA PROTECT YOU AGAINST THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? No . Vaccines against pneumonia , such as pneumococcal vaccine and Haemophilus influenza type B ( Hib ) vaccine , do not provide protection against the new coronavirus . 12 / n MYTH - 10 : CAN REGULARLY RINSING YOUR NOSE WITH SALINE HELP PREVENT INFECTION WITH THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? No . There is no evidence that regularly rinsing the nose with saline has protected people from infection with the new coronavirus . 13 / n MYTH - 12 : DOES THE NEW CORONAVIRUS AFFECT OLDER PEOPLE , OR ARE YOUNGER PEOPLE ALSO SUSCEPTIBLE ? People of all ages can be infected by the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) . 14 / n MYTH - 13 : ARE ANTIBIOTICS EFFECTIVE IN PREVENTING AND TREATING THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? No , antibiotics do not work against viruses , only bacteria . The new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) is a virus and , therefore , antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment . 15 / n MYTH - 14 : ARE THERE ANY SPECIFIC MEDICINES TO PREVENT OR TREAT THE NEW CORONAVIRUS ? Q . What is a CoronaVirus ? A : Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans . In humans , several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases . #coronavirus #coronavirusindia Q . What is COVID - 19 ? A . COVID - 19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus . This new virus and disease were unknown before the outbreak began in Wuhan , China , in December 2019 . Q . What are the symptoms of COVID - 19 ? A . The most common symptoms of COVID - 19 are fever , tiredness , and dry cough . Some patients may have aches and pains , nasal congestion , runny nose , sore throat or diarrhea . These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually . #coronavirus Q . How fatal is COVID - 19 ? A . [ 1/3 ] Most people ( about 80 % ) recover from the disease without needing special treatment . Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets COVID - 19 becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing . [ 2/3 ] Older people , and those with underlying medical problems like high blood pressure , heart problems or diabetes , are more likely to develop serious illness . About 2 % of people with the disease have died . #CoronavirusOutbreak #coronavirusindia Q . How does COVID - 19 spreads ? A . [ 1/3 ] People can catch COVID - 19 from others who have the virus . The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID - 19 coughs or exhales . #CoronaVirusUpdates [ 2/3 ] These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person . Other people then catch COVID - 19 by touching these objects or surfaces , then touching their eyes , nose or mouth . #CoronaAlert #coronavirus [ 3/3 ] People can also catch COVID - 19 if they breathe in droplets from a person with COVID - 19 who coughs out or exhales droplets . This is why it is important to stay more than 1 meter ( 3 feet ) away from a person who is sick . #coronavirusindia Q . Can the virus that causes COVID - 19 be transmitted through the air ? A . Studies to date suggest that the virus that causes COVID - 19 is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air . #coronavirus #coronovirusindia Q . Can CoVID - 19 be caught from a person who has no symptoms ? A . [ 1/2 ] The risk of catching COVID - 19 from someone with no symptoms at all is very low . But many people with COVID - 19 experience only mild symptoms in the early stages . [ 2/2 ] It is therefore possible to catch COVID - 19 from someone who might be infected but has , for example , just a mild cough and does not feel ill . #Corona #coronavirusindia

COVID - 19 is spreading in many countries that do not have 5G mobile networks . COVID - 19 is spread through respiratoatry droplets when an infected person coughs , sneezes or speaks . Exposing yourself to the sun or to temperatures higher than 25C degrees DOES NOT prevent the coronavirus disease ( COVID - 19 ) Evidenced by the surge here at home you can catch COVID - 19 , no matter how sunny or hot the weather is . I moved to another city and drowned myself in Bishop David Oyedepo 's book - UNDERSTANDING DIVINE DIRECTION . I tried applying for jobs during this period and never did I get one . See , I have a very great CV , good schools , excellent grades and awesome work experience . As at that time , I had worked for an Impact Accelerator and Consulting firm in Nairobi , did a three year stint in two large commercial banks with several volunteering experiences . The first test invite I got , I passed and was asked to stay back for an interview same day . I was equally successful and was called to see the CEO which was the last stage of the recruitment process . Maybe my price scared them , I was not called back as promised . The second one I ever got much later , I argued with my interviewer who felt he knew everything . LOL . I did n't get both jobs . Thank God . I am sure God was looking at me and shaking his head like " see this boy I gave a master-plan trying to run the race of someone else " . What am I trying to say ? Everybody has their lane . That a particular trade is booming for someone you know does not mean it will boom for you . You do not know what they know . Forget the glamorous results you see , people 's secret efforts settles most of these things outwardly . Discover your own lane and that is where you will shine effortlessly . This does not in anyway downplay the part of hard work . You will work extra hard and even harder as you go up . Succeeding is easy . Staying successful is not . Many times you see many people post their achievements and accolades on social media and you say to yourself ' why not me ? ' When will it be my own turn ? Do they have two heads ? etc . No ! Nothing is wrong with you . Just discover your own lane and press forward . YOU ARE YOU ! ! ! Most people will not even write about their failures . I AM SUPER PROUD OF MY FAILURES . I failed forward . My failures gave me more lessons and earned me the right and boldness to teach other people about business . Your failures are a plus . You learn never to do things that same way . Reason I embraced the lean approach . I learnt how to start a business with a very little cost , validate and then grow it . HTTPURL ( @USER ) is a clear example . I will tell the story some day By God 's Grace ( ALL GLORY TO GOD ) , doing my entrepreneurship career has gotten me recognition home and abroad including from President Obama through his Foundation , the Dutch Government , The Wharton School , Ventures Platform , Embassy of Ireland in Nigeria ... Others are Regional Universities Forum for Capacity Building in Agriculture ( RUFORUM ) - a network of 121 Vice Chancellors of African Universities , Federal Government of Nigeria , Niger Delta Development Commission ( NDDC ) ... Small and Medium Enterprises Development Agency of Nigeria ( SMEDAN ) , Embassy of France in Nigeria , Bank of Industry , African Entrepreneurship Awards , Morocco , and several others . Because of my work as an entrepreneur , I have had FREE , and I mean COMPLETELY FREE trips to some countries in Africa and Europe . It looks like I am bragging but I am actually not . There were times I applied for these things - put myself forward , pushed and pushed and I always got a NO ! For me to share one award , recognition or free travel that came my way , I may have gotten NOs in a multiple of 10 , if not 20 . There is a particular annual fellowship I have applied for every year from inception back to back for 6 times in 6 years . I will try again the 7th time this year and look forward to being selected . That is how it is . You have to develop a thick skin to getting NOs , see them as part of the process and forge ahead . You have to learn from your mistakes and pick up yourself quickly . You have to ultimately look for your own lane and run your race . Do not let anyone guilt trip you in believing that this life is a competition . We are not wired to do the same things . You also have to stay HUMBLE . Little accolades should not get to your head . If it does , your dreams are so small . Increase the elasticity . That does not mean you will not celebrate your wins . Celebrate them . Enjoy them . But you know what , move on quickly and do the same things you were doing even more . I HAVE MY STORY ! YOU HAVE YOURS ! They are never the same even though our results might be similar . It could even bring us plenty money and fame . But it is never the same . Finally , success is not even about the money and the fame alone . It is about living your life in a way that you feel happy and fulfilled . Only that , money makes the happiness and fulfillment sweeter . Just find your lane , stay there and run your race . Dazzol . Blessed weekend .

Coronavirus disease 2019 , or " COVID - 19 , " is an infection caused by specific virus called SARS-CoV - 2 . The virus first appeared in late 2019 in the city of Wuhan , China . But it has spread quickly through the world People with COVID - 19 can have fever , cough , & trouble with breathing HTTPURL How is COVID - 19 spread ? COVID - 19 spreads from person to person , similar to the flu . This happens when a sick person coughs or sneezes near other people . Its possible to get sick if you touch a surface that has the virus on it and then touch your mouth , nose , or eyes What are the symptoms of COVID - 19 ? Symptoms usually start a few days after a person is infected with the virus . But in some people it can take even longer for symptoms to appear . Symptoms can include : ● Fever ● Cough ● Feeling tired ● Trouble breathing ● Muscle aches Can COVID - 19 be prevented ? ● Wash your hands with soap and water ● Avoid touching your face with your hands , especially your mouth , nose , or eyes . ● Try to stay away from people who have any symptoms of the infection . ● Avoid crowds .

Is COVID - 19 the same as SARS ? No . The virus that causes COVID - 19 and the one that caused the outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ( SARS ) in 2003 are related to each other genetically , but the diseases they cause are quite different . SARS was more deadly but much less infectious than COVID - 19 . There have been no outbreaks of SARS anywhere in the world since 2003 .

Let ´ s help fight the spread of the coronavirus . Let ´ s protect ourselves , our loved ones , colleagues , friends , the community and our country . So here ´ s a thread of Q & A on coronaviruses ( COVID - 19 ) from World Health Organization . #CovidfreeApril #CovidfreePhilippines #CovidfreeWorld Some people become infected but do n't develop any symptoms and do n't feel unwell . Most people ( about 80 % ) recover from the disease without needing special treatment . Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets COVID - 19 becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing . 2/3 Older people , and those with underlying medical problems like high blood pressure , heart problems or diabetes , are more likely to develop serious illness . People with fever , cough and difficulty breathing should seek medical attention . 3/3 How does COVID - 19 spread ? People can catch COVID - 19 from others who have the virus . The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID - 19 coughs or exhales . 1/3 These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person . Other people then catch COVID - 19 by touching these objects or surfaces , then touching their eyes , nose or mouth . 2/3 People can also catch COVID - 19 if they breathe in droplets from a person with COVID - 19 who coughs out or exhales droplets . This is why it is important to stay more than 1 meter ( 3 feet ) away from a person who is sick . 3/3 Can the virus that causes COVID - 19 be transmitted through the air ? Studies to date suggest that the virus that causes COVID - 19 is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air . Can CoVID - 19 be caught from a person who has no symptoms ? The main way the disease spreads is through respiratory droplets expelled by someone who is coughing . The risk of catching COVID - 19 from someone with no symptoms at all is very low . 1/2 However , many people with COVID - 19 experience only mild symptoms . This is particularly true at the early stages of the disease . It is therefore possible to catch COVID - 19 from someone who has , for example , just a mild cough and does not feel ill . 2/2

1 . Is it safe to receive a letter or a package from China ? Yes , it is safe . People receiving packages from China are not at risk of contracting the new coronavirus . From previous analysis , we know coronaviruses do not survive long on objects , such as letters or packages . 2 . Can spraying alcohol or chlorine all over your body kill the new coronavirus ? No . Spraying alcohol or chlorine on your body will not kill viruses that have already entered your body . Rather , spraying such substances can be harmful to clothes or mucous membranes ( eyes , mouth ) . 3 . How effective are thermal scanners in detecting people infected with the new coronavirus ? Thermal scanners are effective in detecting people who have developed a fever because of infection . However , they can not detect people who are infected but are not yet sick with fever . 4 . Can an ultraviolet disinfection lamp kill the new coronavirus ? UV lamps should not be used to sterilize hands or other areas of skin as UV radiation can cause skin irritation . 5 . Are hand dryers effective in killing the new coronavirus ? No . Hand dryers are not effective in killing the new coronavirus . To protect yourself against the new coronavirus , you should frequently clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap & water . 6 . Can pets at home spread the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) ? At present , there is no evidence that companion animals / pets such as dogs or cats can be infected with the new coronavirus . However , it is always a good idea to wash your hands with soap & water after contact with pets . 7 . Do vaccines against pneumonia protect you against the new coronavirus ? No . Vaccines against pneumonia offer no protection against the new coronavirus . The virus is so new and different that it needs its own vaccine . Researchers are trying to develop one & WHO is in support . 8 . Does the new coronavirus affect older people , or are younger people also susceptible ? People of all ages can be infected by the new coronavirus but older people & those with pre-existing medical conditions ( such as asthma , diabetes , etc . ) appear to be more vulnerable . WHO advises people of all ages to take steps to protect themselves from the virus , for example by following good hand hygiene and good respiratory hygiene . 9 . Are antibiotics effective in preventing and treating the new coronavirus ? No , antibiotics do not work against viruses , only bacteria . The new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) is a virus and , therefore , antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment . 10 . Are there any specific medicines to prevent or treat the new coronavirus ? To date , there is no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat the new coronavirus . However , those infected with the virus are receiving appropriate care to relieve and treat symptoms .

I 've read a lot about Corona virus lately and I think I should share some highlights of the good read . It 's a #Thread , and in form of Q & A . What is a coronavirus ? Coronavirus is a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans . In humans , several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from common cold to MERS & SARS . The most recently discovered coronavirus is COVID - 19 . What is COVID - 19 ? COVID - 19 is the INFECTIOUS disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus . This new virus and disease were unknown before the outbreak began in Wuhan , China , in December 2019 . The most common symptoms of COVID - 19 are fever , tiredness , & dry cough . Some patients may have aches & pains , nasal congestion , runny nose , sore throat or diarrhea . These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually . Some people become infected but do n't develop any symptoms . Older people , and those with underlying medical problems like high blood pressure , heart problems or diabetes , are more likely to develop serious illness . People with fever , cough and difficulty breathing should seek medical attention . How does COVID - 19 spread ? People can catch COVID - 19 from others who have the virus . The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID - 19 coughs or exhales . How likely am I to catch COVID - 19 ? The risk depends on where you are - and more specifically , whether there is a COVID - 19 outbreak unfolding there . Should I worry about COVID - 19 ? Although illness due to COVID - 19 infection is generally mild , especially for children and young adults . It is still quite normal for people to worry about how the COVID - 19 outbreak will affect them and their loved ones . Are antibiotics effective in preventing or treating the COVID - 19 ? No . Antibiotics do not work against viruses , they only work on bacterial infections . COVID - 19 is caused by a virus , so antibiotics do not work . Is there a vaccine , drug or treatment for COVID - 19 ? Not yet . To date , there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat COVID - 2019 . However , those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms . People with serious illness should be hospitalized . Is COVID - 19 the same as SARS ? No . The virus that causes COVID - 19 and the one that causes Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ( SARS ) are related to each other genetically , but they are different . SARS is MORE DEADLY but much less infectious than COVID - 19 . Should I wear a mask to protect myself ? Only wear a mask if you are ill with COVID - 19 symptoms ( especially coughing ) or looking after someone who may have COVID - 19 . The mask can only be used once . If you are not ill / looking after someone who is ill then you are WASTING a mask . Can I catch COVID - 19 from my pet ? No . There is no evidence that companion animals or pets such as cats and dogs have been infected or could spread the virus that causes COVID - 19 . Is there anything I should not do ? The following measures ARE NOT effective against COVID - 2019 and can be harmful : 1 . Smoking 2 . Taking traditional herbal remedies 3 . Wearing multiple masks 4 . Taking self-medication such as antibiotics . In any case , if you have fever , cough and difficulty breathing seek medical care early to reduce the risk of developing a more severe infection and be sure to share your recent travel history with your health care provider . #CoronaAlert #coronavirus #CoronaOutbreak #Thread

THREAD With a lot of misinformation circulating , we clear up some of the biggest misconceptions around the outbreak . Coronavirus myths debunked :backhand_index_pointing_down: HTTPURL Can #COVID19 be transmitted through mosquito bites ? No - the new coronavirus is a respiratory virus which spreads mainly through droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes , or through droplets of saliva or discharge from the nose . HTTPURL Do vaccines against pneumonia protect you against the new coronavirus ? No - the virus is so new and different that it needs its own vaccine . HTTPURL Can garlic keep you safe from #COVID19 ? Garlic is a healthy food - but there 's no evidence to suggest eating it protects you from the coronavirus . HTTPURL Does the new coronavirus only affect older people ? Younger people also susceptible - people of all ages can be infected . HTTPURL Are antibiotics effective in preventing and treating the new coronavirus ? No , antibiotics do not work against viruses . However if hospitalised , antibiotics may be given because bacterial co-infection is possible . HTTPURL Overwhelmed by all the #coronavirus news ? We 've put together a handy guide answering the most-asked questions :backhand_index_pointing_down: HTTPURL

" People of all ages can be infected by Covid 19 .. Older people , and people with pre-existing medical conditions ( such as asthma , diabetes , heart disease ) appear to be more vulnerable to becoming severely ill with the virus . " - WHO Are antibiotics effective in preventing and treating the new coronavirus ? No , antibiotics do not work against viruses , only bacteria . So please do not ask for antibiotics to protect against covid 19 Even though the older , more immunocompromised patients with pre-existing conditions are more likely to be more ill with Covid 19 It 's not a reason to be complacent if you are " healthy " . . you can still transmit the virus to your less healthy relatives / friends / strangers ATTENTION : The CDC does not recommend that people who are well wear a facemask to protect themselves from COVID - 19 . Only wear a mask if recommended by your healthcare professional . A facemask should also be used by people who have COVID - 19 and are showing symptoms . 1/2 This is to protect others from the risk of getting infected . The use of facemasks also is crucial for health workers and other people who are taking care of someone infected with COVID - 19 in close settings ( at home or in a health care facility ) . - CDC ... 2/2 What is close contact ? Acc to the CDC a ) being within approximately 6 feet ( 2 meters ) of a COVID - 19 case for a prolonged period of time – or – b ) having direct contact with infectious secretions of a COVID - 19 case ( e . g . , being coughed on ) Dear fellow health care providers CDC recommends that we Maintain PRIVACY N CONFIDENTIALITY of Covid 19 patients ( and the suspected and exposed ) Raise awareness without causing fear Share ACCURATE info Speak out against negative behaviors / statements on social media

1/2 Seems there are people about who think Covid 19 is just like the Flu . 1 ) It is far more transmissible . 2 ) It requires a much lesser viral load in order to infect people . 3 ) The incidence of becoming seriously ill and requiring hospital treatment is astronomically greater . 2/2 4 ) If you do require hospital treatment the likelihood of dying is also astronomically greater . 5 ) STOP comparing stats from a virus that has n't even left the starting block yet , with * several * versions of flu that have ran their course over a year .

Part 16 What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease ? Protection measures for everyone Stay aware of the latest information on the COVID - 19 outbreak , available on the WHO website and through your national and local public health authority . #FREDIBOAT Part 17 Many countries around the world have seen cases of COVID - 19 and several have seen outbreaks . Authorities in China and some other countries have succeeded in slowing or stopping their outbreaks . However , the situation is unpredictable so check regularly #FREDIBOAT for the latest news . Part 18 You can reduce your chances of being infected or spreading COVID - 19 by taking some simple precautions : Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water . Why ? Washing your hands with #FREDIBOAT Part 19 droplets from their nose or mouth which may contain virus . If you are too close , you can breathe in the droplets , including the COVID - 19 virus if the person coughing has the disease . Avoid touching eyes , nose and mouth . Why ? Hands touch many #FREDIBOAT Part 20 surfaces and can pick up viruses . Once contaminated , hands can transfer the virus to your eyes , nose or mouth . From there , the virus can enter your body and can make you sick . Make sure you , and the people around you , follow good respiratory hygiene . #FREDIBOAT Part 21 This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze . Then dispose of the used tissue immediately . Why ? Droplets spread virus . By following good respiratory hygiene you protect the people around you from viruses such as Part 22 cold , flu and COVID - 19 . Stay home if you feel unwell . If you have a fever , cough and difficulty breathing , seek medical attention and call in advance . Follow the directions of your local health authority . Why ? National and local authorities will #FREDIBOAT Part 23 have the most up to date information on the situation in your area . Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility . This will also protect you and help prevent spread of viruses and other infections . #FREDIBOAT Part 24 Keep up to date on the latest COVID - 19 hotspots ( cities or local areas where COVID - 19 is spreading widely ) . If possible , avoid traveling to places – especially if you are an older person or have diabetes , heart or lung disease . Why ? #FREDIBOAT Part 25 You have a higher chance of catching COVID - 19 in one of these areas . * * * Protection measures for persons who are in or have recently visited ( past 14 days ) areas where COVID - 19 is spreading Follow the guidance outlined above ( Protection measures for #FREDIBOAT Part 26 everyone ) Self-isolate by staying at home if you begin to feel unwell , even with mild symptoms such as headache , low grade fever ( 37.3 C or above ) and slight runny nose , until you recover . If it is essential for you to have someone bring you supplies or #FREDIBOAT Part 27 to go out , e . g . to buy food , then wear a mask to avoid infecting other people . Why ? Avoiding contact with others and visits to medical facilities will allow these facilities to operate more effectively and help protect you and others from possible COVID - 19 #FREDIBOAT Part 28 and other viruses . If you develop fever , cough and difficulty breathing , seek medical advice promptly as this may be due to a respiratory infection or other serious condition . Call in advance and tell your provider of any recent travel or contact with travelers . Part 28 Why ? Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility . This will also help to prevent possible spread of COVID - 19 and other viruses . #FREDIBOAT Part 29 How likely am I to catch COVID - 19 ? The risk depends on where you are - and more specifically , whether there is a COVID - 19 outbreak unfolding there . For most people in most locations the risk of catching COVID - 19 is still low . However , there are now places around Part 30 the world ( cities or areas ) where the disease is spreading . For people living in , or visiting , these areas the risk of catching COVID - 19 is higher . Governments and health authorities are taking vigorous action every time a new case of COVID - 19 is identified . Be sure to Part 31 comply with any local restrictions on travel , movement or large gatherings . Cooperating with disease control efforts will reduce your risk of catching or spreading COVID - 19 . COVID - 19 outbreaks can be contained and transmission stopped , as has been shown in #FREDIBOAT Part 32 China and some other countries . Unfortunately , new outbreaks can emerge rapidly . It 's important to be aware of the situation where you are or intend to go . WHO publishes daily updates on the COVID - 19 situation worldwide . You can see these at HTTPURL

HOW DOES COVID - 19 SPREAD ? :sneezing_face: People can catch COVID - 19 from others who have the virus . :sweat_droplets: The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID - 19 coughs or exhales . :spoon: These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person . :backhand_index_pointing_left: Other people then catch COVID - 19 by touching these objects or surfaces , then touching their eyes , nose or mouth . :left-right_arrow: People can also catch COVID - 19 if they breathe in droplets from a person with COVID - 19 who coughs out or exhales droplets . This is why it is important to stay more than 1 meter ( 3 feet ) away from a person who is sick . WHO is assessing ongoing research on the ways COVID - 19 is spread and will continue to share updated findings . Can the virus that causes COVID - 19 be transmitted through the air ? Studies to date suggest that the virus that causes COVID - 19 is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air . Can COVID - 19 be caught from a person who has no symptoms ? The main way the disease spreads is through respiratory droplets expelled by someone who is coughing . The risk of catching COVID - 19 from someone with no symptoms at all is very low . However , many people with COVID - 19 experience only mild symptoms . This is particularly true at the early stages of the disease . It is therefore possible to catch COVID - 19 from someone who has , for example , just a mild cough and does not feel ill . #WHOWhatsapp

Q . What is a CoronaVirus ? A : Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans . In humans , several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases . #coronavirus #coronavirusindia Q . What is COVID - 19 ? A . COVID - 19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus . This new virus and disease were unknown before the outbreak began in Wuhan , China , in December 2019 . Q . What are the symptoms of COVID - 19 ? A . The most common symptoms of COVID - 19 are fever , tiredness , and dry cough . Some patients may have aches and pains , nasal congestion , runny nose , sore throat or diarrhea . These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually . #coronavirus Q . How fatal is COVID - 19 ? A . [ 1/3 ] Most people ( about 80 % ) recover from the disease without needing special treatment . Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets COVID - 19 becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing . [ 2/3 ] Older people , and those with underlying medical problems like high blood pressure , heart problems or diabetes , are more likely to develop serious illness . About 2 % of people with the disease have died . #CoronavirusOutbreak #coronavirusindia Q . How does COVID - 19 spreads ? A . [ 1/3 ] People can catch COVID - 19 from others who have the virus . The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID - 19 coughs or exhales . #CoronaVirusUpdates [ 2/3 ] These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person . Other people then catch COVID - 19 by touching these objects or surfaces , then touching their eyes , nose or mouth . #CoronaAlert #coronavirus [ 3/3 ] People can also catch COVID - 19 if they breathe in droplets from a person with COVID - 19 who coughs out or exhales droplets . This is why it is important to stay more than 1 meter ( 3 feet ) away from a person who is sick . #coronavirusindia Q . Can the virus that causes COVID - 19 be transmitted through the air ? A . Studies to date suggest that the virus that causes COVID - 19 is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air . #coronavirus #coronovirusindia Q . Can CoVID - 19 be caught from a person who has no symptoms ? A . [ 1/2 ] The risk of catching COVID - 19 from someone with no symptoms at all is very low . But many people with COVID - 19 experience only mild symptoms in the early stages . [ 2/2 ] It is therefore possible to catch COVID - 19 from someone who might be infected but has , for example , just a mild cough and does not feel ill . #Corona #coronavirusindia

How to put on , use , take off and dispose of a mask ? 1 . Remember , a mask should only be used by health workers , care takers , and individuals with respiratory symptoms , such as fever and cough . 1/10 2 . Before touching the mask , clean hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or soap and water 2/10 3 . Take the mask and inspect it for tears or holes . 3/10 4 . Orient which side is the top side ( where the metal strip is ) . 4/10 5 . Ensure the proper side of the mask faces outwards ( the coloured side ) . 5/10 6 . Place the mask to your face . Pinch the metal strip or stiff edge of the mask so it moulds to the shape of your nose . 6/10 7 . Pull down the mask 's bottom so it covers your mouth and your chin . 7/10 8 . After use , take off the mask ; remove the elastic loops from behind the ears while keeping the mask away from your face and clothes , to avoid touching potentially contaminated surfaces of the mask . 8/ 10 9 . Discard the mask in a closed bin immediately after use . 9/10 10 . Perform hand hygiene after touching or discarding the mask – Use alcohol-based hand rub or , if visibly soiled , wash your hands with soap and water . 10/10

The most common symptoms of COVID - 19 are fever , tiredness , & dry cough . Some patients may have aches & pains , nasal congestion , runny nose , sore throat or diarrhea . These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually . Some people become infected but do n't develop any symptoms . Are antibiotics effective in preventing or treating the COVID - 19 ? No . Antibiotics do not work against viruses , they only work on bacterial infections . COVID - 19 is caused by a virus , so antibiotics do not work . Is there a vaccine , drug or treatment for COVID - 19 ? Not yet . To date , there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat COVID - 2019 . However , those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms . People with serious illness should be hospitalized . Is COVID - 19 the same as SARS ? No . The virus that causes COVID - 19 and the one that causes Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ( SARS ) are related to each other genetically , but they are different . SARS is MORE DEADLY but much less infectious than COVID - 19 . Should I wear a mask to protect myself ? Only wear a mask if you are ill with COVID - 19 symptoms ( especially coughing ) or looking after someone who may have COVID - 19 . The mask can only be used once . If you are not ill / looking after someone who is ill then you are WASTING a mask . Can I catch COVID - 19 from my pet ? No . There is no evidence that companion animals or pets such as cats and dogs have been infected or could spread the virus that causes COVID - 19 . Is there anything I should not do ? The following measures ARE NOT effective against COVID - 2019 and can be harmful : 1 . Smoking 2 . Taking traditional herbal remedies 3 . Wearing multiple masks 4 . Taking self-medication such as antibiotics . In any case , if you have fever , cough and difficulty breathing seek medical care early to reduce the risk of developing a more severe infection and be sure to share your recent travel history with your health care provider . #CoronaAlert #coronavirus #CoronaOutbreak #Thread

@USER @USER @USER Q : Can gargling mouthwash protect you from infection with the new #coronavirus ? A : No . There is no evidence that using mouthwash will protect you from infection with the new coronavirus . More myth busters 👉🏽 HTTPURL HTTPURL Q : Can regularly rinsing your nose with saline help prevent infection with the new coronavirus ? A : No . There is no evidence that regularly rinsing the nose with saline has protected people from infection with the new coronavirus . More myth busters : HTTPURL HTTPURL @USER @USER We answer more rumours and myths about the 2019 novel #coronavirus . Q : Can the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) survive in hot and humid climates ? A : Yes , 2019 - nCoV has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates , as well as cold and dry . HTTPURL Q : If drinking water alleviates a sore throat , does this also protect against #2019nCoV infection ? A : While staying hydrated by drinking water is important for overall health , it does not prevent coronavirus infection . HTTPURL Q : Does drinking alcohol prevent the new #coronavirus ? A : No , drinking alcohol does not protect you from 2019 - nCoV infection . Alcohol should always be consumed in moderation & people who do not drink alcohol should not start drinking in an attempt to prevent 2019 - nCoV infection . HTTPURL @USER @USER Q : Does #2019nCoV spread through the air ( e . g . through air conditioning or via e-cigarette emissions ) ? A : Current evidence suggests the new coronavirus spreads primarily through close contact with an infected person or the droplets released when they cough or sneeze . HTTPURL @USER @USER Q : What type of disinfectant can I use to wipe down surfaces to protect against #COVID19 ? A : If a surface is dirty , first wipe it down with regular household soap or detergent & rinse with water . Then use a regular household disinfectant like bleach . HTTPURL @USER @USER Q : What should I do if shops are sold out of hand sanitizer ? A : That 's okay . Washing your hands using regular soap and water is also effective against #COVID19 . Remember to wash between your fingers , the backs of your hands & around your nails . :video_camera: : HTTPURL HTTPURL

Q : Are antibiotics effective in preventing and treating the new #coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) ? A : No , antibiotics do not work against viruses , only bacteria . The 2019 - nC0V is a virus and , therefore , antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment . @USER HTTPURL Q : Does the new #coronavirus ( 2019 - nC0V ) affect older people , or are younger people also susceptible ? A : People of all ages can be infected by the virus . Older people & those with pre-existing medical conditions appear to be more vulnerable to becoming severely ill with the virus HTTPURL Q : Can pets at home spread the new #coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) ? A : At present , there is no evidence that companion animals / pets such as dogs , cats can be infected with the virus . However , it is always a good idea to wash your hands with soap and water after contact with pets @USER HTTPURL Q : Are there any specific medicines to prevent or treat the new #coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) ? A : To date , there is no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat the virus . WHO is helping to accelerate research and development efforts with a range of partners . @USER HTTPURL Q : Do vaccines against pneumonia protect you against #2019nCoV ? A : No . Vaccines against pneumonia do not provide protection against 2019 - nCoV . The virus is new and different . It needs its own vaccine . #KnowTheFacts @USER HTTPURL Q : Is it safe to receive a letter or a package from China ? A : Yes , it is safe . A short thread on evidence and our responsibility as healthcare professionals . " 5G mobile networks DO NOT spread COVID - 19 " This is a REAL myth buster infographic by the @USER . In fact , it 's the very first infographic that 's listed under the section " Advice for Public " . HTTPURL Here 's another one fighting against the myth that garlic prevents infection . HTTPURL HTTPURL These myths might seem absurd to many of us . It 's clear though that this kind of misinformation continues to circulate widely ( and maybe not in the groups that we are a part of ) . HTTPURL As a healthcare community , we need to re-establish ourselves as the voices of reason . Where this starts , however , is with independent and critical appraisal of the best available evidence by each and every one of us . The media ( and that includes reputable sources ) will continue to simplify and sensationalize scientific news . Indiscriminate sharing of articles summarizing papers and posts with one-liners from abstracts only perpetuates and validates this . If we are n't reading the papers and pointing out flaws in internal and external validities , who will ? And most importantly , if we are n't appraising and translating the evidence into something the public can understand , who will ? We need to continue to support and strengthen the voices of those who take the time to provide balanced assessments through this unique time . How effective are thermal scanners in detecting people infected with the new coronavirus ? Thermal scanners are effective in detecting people who have developed a fever ( i . e . have a higher than normal body temperature ) bcz of infection with new coronavirus . #KHKTCoronaCampaign However , they can not detect people who are infected but are not yet sick with fever . This is because it takes between 2 and 10 days before people who are infected become sick and develop a fever . #KHKTCoronaCampaign

WHAT ARE CORONAVIRUSES , COVID - 19 AND HOW ARE THEY RELATED TO SARS ? What is a coronavirus ? Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans . In humans , several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome ( MERS ) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ( SARS ) . The most recently discovered coronavirus causes coronavirus disease COVID - 19 . What is COVID - 19 ? COVID - 19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus . This new virus and disease were unknown before the outbreak began in Wuhan , China , in Dec 2019 . Is COVID - 19 the same as SARS ? No . The virus that causes COVID - 19 and the one that caused the outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ( SARS ) in 2003 are related to each other genetically , but the diseases they cause are quite different . SARS was more deadly but much less infectious than COVID - 19 . There have been no outbreaks of SARS anywhere in the world since 2003 .

What is COVID - 19 ? COVID - 19 is a disease caused by a new strain of coronavirus . ‘ CO ' stands for corona , ‘ VI ' for virus , and ‘ D ' for disease . Formerly , this disease was referred to as ‘ 2019 novel coronavirus ' or ‘ 2019 - nCoV . ' HTTPURL What are the symptoms of COVID - 19 ? Symptoms can include fever , cough and shortness of breath . In more severe cases , infection can cause pneumonia or breathing difficulties . More rarely , the disease can be fatal . These symptoms are similar to the flu ( influenza ) or common cold . Q : Can pets :dog_face: :cat_face: at home spread the new #coronavirus ? A : At present , there is no evidence that companion animals / pets such as dogs , cats can be infected with the virus . However , it is always a good idea to wash your hands with soap and water after contact with pets . HTTPURL Q : Are there any specific medicines to prevent or treat the new #coronavirus ? A : To date , there is no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat the virus . However , those infected should receive appropriate care to relieve and treat symptoms . HTTPURL Q : Is it safe to receive a letter :envelope: or a package :package: from China ? A : Yes , it is safe . People receiving packages from China are not at risk of contracting the new coronavirus . From previous analysis , we know coronaviruses do not survive long on objects , such as letters or packages . HTTPURL @USER @USER @USER Q : Can eating garlic :garlic: help prevent infection with the new #coronavirus ? A : Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties . However , there is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus . HTTPURL @USER @USER @USER Q : Can gargling mouthwash protect you from infection with the new #coronavirus ? A : No . There is no evidence that using mouthwash will protect you from infection with the new coronavirus . More myth busters 👉🏽 HTTPURL HTTPURL Q : Can regularly rinsing your nose with saline help prevent infection with the new coronavirus ? A : No . There is no evidence that regularly rinsing the nose with saline has protected people from infection with the new coronavirus . More myth busters : HTTPURL HTTPURL @USER @USER We answer more rumours and myths about the 2019 novel #coronavirus . Q : Can the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) survive in hot and humid climates ? A : Yes , 2019 - nCoV has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates , as well as cold and dry . HTTPURL Q : If drinking water alleviates a sore throat , does this also protect against #2019nCoV infection ? A : While staying hydrated by drinking water is important for overall health , it does not prevent coronavirus infection . HTTPURL Q : Does drinking alcohol prevent the new #coronavirus ? A : No , drinking alcohol does not protect you from 2019 - nCoV infection . Alcohol should always be consumed in moderation & people who do not drink alcohol should not start drinking in an attempt to prevent 2019 - nCoV infection . HTTPURL @USER @USER Q : Does #2019nCoV spread through the air ( e . g . through air conditioning or via e-cigarette emissions ) ? A : Current evidence suggests the new coronavirus spreads primarily through close contact with an infected person or the droplets released when they cough or sneeze . HTTPURL @USER @USER Q : What type of disinfectant can I use to wipe down surfaces to protect against #COVID19 ? A : If a surface is dirty , first wipe it down with regular household soap or detergent & rinse with water . Then use a regular household disinfectant like bleach . HTTPURL @USER @USER Q : What should I do if shops are sold out of hand sanitizer ? A : That 's okay . Washing your hands using regular soap and water is also effective against #COVID19 . Remember to wash between your fingers , the backs of your hands & around your nails . :video_camera: : HTTPURL HTTPURL

* What are the treatment options for COVID - 19 ( including drugs , vaccines , therapies ) ? * :pill: * Are antibiotics effective in preventing or treating COVID - 19 ? * No . Antibiotics do not work against viruses , they only work on bacterial infections . COVID - 19 is caused by a virus , so antibiotics do not work . Antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment of COVID - 19 . They should only be used as directed by a physician to treat a bacterial infection . :test_tube: * Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure COVID - 19 ? * While cure for COVID - 19 . However , there are several ongoing clinical trials that include both western and traditional medicines . WHO will continue to provide updated information as soon as clinical findings are available . :syringe: * Is there a vaccine , drug or treatment for COVID - 19 ? * Not some western , traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID - 19 , there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease . WHO does not recommend self-medication with any medicines , including antibiotics , as a prevention or yet . To date , there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat COVID - 2019 . However , those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms . People with serious illness should be hospitalized . Most patients recover thanks to supportive care . Possible vaccines and some specific drug treatments are under investigation . They are being tested through clinical trials . WHO is coordinating efforts to develop vaccines and medicines to prevent and treat COVID - 19 . In the race to stop the spread of COVID - 19 , some are wondering if #HerdImmunity is the answer . But what is that exactly ? Here 's what things look like now : HTTPURL Here 's what that looks like : HTTPURL For this to work , 70 percent of the population would need to have immunity . That 's 229,767 , 666 people in the U . S . alone . HTTPURL Scientists reached this threshold by figuring out how infectious COVID - 19 is specifically . This is called R0 value . It measures how many people an infected person is likely to infect . This is how COVID - 19 ' s R0 values compare to other diseases . HTTPURL Even though the numbers are high and it may seem simple at first glance , most scientists are n't onboard with relying on #HerdImmunity . Why ? This tactic would take between 1 million - 2 million deaths in the U . S . and 30 million around the world . That 's millions too many . HTTPURL Until a vaccine can provide widespread immunity , communities need to prioritize keeping case numbers low and manageable , especially heading into the fall , when more activities will have to move indoors and the flu season will add more strain . The alternative would be devastating . Experts also noted that by social distancing , we can mimic this tactic . Staying six feet away from others also prevents the virus from bouncing to a new person . Interested in learning more about COVID - 19 and #HerdImmunity ? @USER has more here :right_arrow_curving_down: HTTPURL

1 . #Coronavirus are a large family of viruses that are known to cause illness ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome ( MERS ) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ( SARS ) . #coronarovirus #coronavirusindia 2 . Coronavirus are Zoonotic , meaning they are transmitted between animals & people . #coronarovirus #coronavirusindia #CoronavirusWho 3 . Q — What Is A Novel Coronavirus ? A - - A novel coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) is a new strain of coronavirus that has not been previously identified in humans #coronarovirus #coronavirusindia #CoronavirusWho 4 . Q — Can Humans become infected with a novel coronavirus of animal source ? A — Yes , such instances have happened in past in 2002 in China & 2012 in Saudi Arabia . But with different virus 5 . symptoms of someone infected A-Common signs of infection include respiratory symptoms , fever , cough , shortness of breath and breathing difficulties . In more severe cases , infection can cause pneumonia , severe acute respiratory syndrome , kidney failure and even death . 6 . Can Coronavirus be transmitted from person to person ? A - - Yes , some coronaviruses can be transmitted from person to person , usually after close contact with an infected patient , for example , in a household workplace , or health care centre . #coronarovirus #coronavirusindia 7 . Who is at higher risk of infection by nCoV ? A - - Highest risk is among people are at extremes of age or have existence of other infections . 8 . Is there a vaccine for Novel Coronavirus ? A--When a disease is new , there is no vaccine until one is developed . It can take a number of years for a new vaccine to be developed . #coronarovirus #coronavirusindia 9.What are the treatment for infection ? There is no specific treatment for disease caused by a novel coronavirus . However , many of the symptoms can be treated and based on the patient 's clinical condition . Moreover , supportive care for infected persons can be highly effective . 10 . How do I protect myself ? How does COVID - 19 spread ? People can catch COVID - 19 from others who have the virus . The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID - 19 coughs or exhales . Are antibiotics effective in preventing or treating the COVID - 19 ? No . Antibiotics do not work against viruses , they only work on bacterial infections . COVID - 19 is caused by a virus , so antibiotics do not work . Is there a vaccine , drug or treatment for COVID - 19 ? Not yet . To date , there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat COVID - 2019 . However , those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms . People with serious illness should be hospitalized . Is COVID - 19 the same as SARS ? No . The virus that causes COVID - 19 and the one that causes Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome ( SARS ) are related to each other genetically , but they are different . SARS is MORE DEADLY but much less infectious than COVID - 19 . Should I wear a mask to protect myself ? Only wear a mask if you are ill with COVID - 19 symptoms ( especially coughing ) or looking after someone who may have COVID - 19 . The mask can only be used once . If you are not ill / looking after someone who is ill then you are WASTING a mask . Can I catch COVID - 19 from my pet ? No . There is no evidence that companion animals or pets such as cats and dogs have been infected or could spread the virus that causes COVID - 19 . Is there anything I should not do ? The following measures ARE NOT effective against COVID - 2019 and can be harmful : 1 . Smoking 2 . Taking traditional herbal remedies 3 . Wearing multiple masks 4 . Taking self-medication such as antibiotics . In any case , if you have fever , cough and difficulty breathing seek medical care early to reduce the risk of developing a more severe infection and be sure to share your recent travel history with your health care provider . #CoronaAlert #coronavirus #CoronaOutbreak #Thread

9.Can CoVID - 19 be caught from a person who has no symptoms ? The main way the disease spreads is through respiratory droplets expelled by someone who is coughing . The risk of catching COVID - 19 from someone with no symptoms at all is very low . Bisakah tertular CoVID - 19 dari orang yang tidak memiliki gejala ? Cara utama penyebaran penyakit ini adalah melalui percikan / droplet yang dikeluarkan oleh seseorang yang batuk . Risiko terkena COVID - 19 dari seseorang tanpa gejala sama sekali sangat rendah . However , many people with COVID - 19 experience only mild symptoms . This is particularly true at the early stages of the disease . It is therefore possible to catch COVID - 19 from someone who has , for example , just a mild cough and does not feel ill . Namun , banyak orang dengan COVID - 19 hanya mengalami gejala ringan . Ini sebenarnya pada tahap awal penyakit . Karena itu dimungkinkan untuk tertular COVID - 19 dari seseorang yang , misalnya , hanya batuk ringan dan tidak merasa sakit .

Part 9 Can the virus that causes COVID - 19 be transmitted through the air ? Studies to date suggest that the virus that causes COVID - 19 is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air . See previous answer on “ How does COVID - 19 spread ? ” Part 10 Can CoVID - 19 be caught from a person who has no symptoms ? The main way the disease spreads is through respiratory droplets expelled by someone who is coughing . The risk of catching COVID - 19 from someone with no symptoms at all is very low . However , #FREDIBOAT Part 13 Can I catch COVID - 19 from the feces of someone with the disease ? The risk of catching COVID - 19 from the feces of an infected person appears to be low . While initial investigations suggest the virus may be present in feces in some cases , spread through this #FREDIBOAT Part 14 route is not a main feature of the outbreak . WHO is assessing ongoing research on the ways COVID - 19 is spread and will continue to share new findings . #FREDIBOAT Part 15 Because this is a risk , however , it is another reason to clean hands regularly , after using the bathroom and before eating #FREDIBOAT Part 16 What can I do to protect myself and prevent the spread of disease ? Protection measures for everyone Stay aware of the latest information on the COVID - 19 outbreak , available on the WHO website and through your national and local public health authority . #FREDIBOAT Part 17 Many countries around the world have seen cases of COVID - 19 and several have seen outbreaks . Authorities in China and some other countries have succeeded in slowing or stopping their outbreaks . However , the situation is unpredictable so check regularly #FREDIBOAT for the latest news . Part 18 You can reduce your chances of being infected or spreading COVID - 19 by taking some simple precautions : Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water . Why ? Washing your hands with #FREDIBOAT Part 19 droplets from their nose or mouth which may contain virus . If you are too close , you can breathe in the droplets , including the COVID - 19 virus if the person coughing has the disease . Avoid touching eyes , nose and mouth . Why ? Hands touch many #FREDIBOAT Part 20 surfaces and can pick up viruses . Once contaminated , hands can transfer the virus to your eyes , nose or mouth . From there , the virus can enter your body and can make you sick . Make sure you , and the people around you , follow good respiratory hygiene . #FREDIBOAT Part 21 This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze . Then dispose of the used tissue immediately . Why ? Droplets spread virus . By following good respiratory hygiene you protect the people around you from viruses such as Part 22 cold , flu and COVID - 19 . Stay home if you feel unwell . If you have a fever , cough and difficulty breathing , seek medical attention and call in advance . Follow the directions of your local health authority . Why ? National and local authorities will #FREDIBOAT Part 23 have the most up to date information on the situation in your area . Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility . This will also protect you and help prevent spread of viruses and other infections . #FREDIBOAT Part 24 Keep up to date on the latest COVID - 19 hotspots ( cities or local areas where COVID - 19 is spreading widely ) . If possible , avoid traveling to places – especially if you are an older person or have diabetes , heart or lung disease . Why ? #FREDIBOAT Part 25 You have a higher chance of catching COVID - 19 in one of these areas . * * * Protection measures for persons who are in or have recently visited ( past 14 days ) areas where COVID - 19 is spreading Follow the guidance outlined above ( Protection measures for #FREDIBOAT Part 26 everyone ) Self-isolate by staying at home if you begin to feel unwell , even with mild symptoms such as headache , low grade fever ( 37.3 C or above ) and slight runny nose , until you recover . If it is essential for you to have someone bring you supplies or #FREDIBOAT Part 27 to go out , e . g . to buy food , then wear a mask to avoid infecting other people . Why ? Avoiding contact with others and visits to medical facilities will allow these facilities to operate more effectively and help protect you and others from possible COVID - 19 #FREDIBOAT Part 28 Why ? Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility . This will also help to prevent possible spread of COVID - 19 and other viruses . #FREDIBOAT Part 29 How likely am I to catch COVID - 19 ? The risk depends on where you are - and more specifically , whether there is a COVID - 19 outbreak unfolding there . For most people in most locations the risk of catching COVID - 19 is still low . However , there are now places around Part 30 the world ( cities or areas ) where the disease is spreading . For people living in , or visiting , these areas the risk of catching COVID - 19 is higher . Governments and health authorities are taking vigorous action every time a new case of COVID - 19 is identified . Be sure to Part 31 comply with any local restrictions on travel , movement or large gatherings . Cooperating with disease control efforts will reduce your risk of catching or spreading COVID - 19 . COVID - 19 outbreaks can be contained and transmission stopped , as has been shown in #FREDIBOAT Part 32 China and some other countries . Unfortunately , new outbreaks can emerge rapidly . Just as fast as the virus has spread so has the misinformation surrounding COVID - 19 which can be equally as harmful . In this thread you 'll find many of the popular theories debunked as outlined by the @USER . 5G mobile networks DO NOT spread COVID - 19 Viruses can not travel on radio waves / mobile networks . COVID - 19 is spreading in many countries that do not have 5G mobile networks . COVID - 19 is spread through respiratoatry droplets when an infected person coughs , sneezes or speaks . Exposing yourself to the sun or to temperatures higher than 25C degrees DOES NOT prevent the coronavirus disease ( COVID - 19 ) Evidenced by the surge here at home you can catch COVID - 19 , no matter how sunny or hot the weather is . Countries with hot weather have had numerous cases . The new coronavirus CANNOT be transmitted through mosquito bites . To date there has been no information nor evidence to suggest that the new coronavirus could be transmitted by mosquitoes . Black People Can Get Corona . Data on race and the virus is too limited to draw sweeping conclusions , but disparate rates of sickness and death have emerged in some places . COVID - 19 is infecting and killing black people in the US at disproportionately high rates . @USER

Q . Can I catch COVID - 19 from my pet ? A : No . There is no evidence that companion animals or pets such as cats and dogs have been infected or could spread the virus that causes COVID - 19 . #Coronvirus #CoronaAlert #CoronavirusReachesDelhi Q . Can humans become infected with the COVID - 19 from an animal source ? A :[ 1/2 ] Possible animal sources of COVID - 19 have not yet been confirmed . To protect yourself , such as when visiting live animal markets , avoid direct contact with animals and surfaces in contact with animals . [ 2/2 ] Ensure good food safety practices at all times . Handle raw meat , milk or animal organs with care to avoid contamination of uncooked foods and avoid consuming raw or under cooked animal products . #Coronvirus #CoronaOutbreak #CoronaAlert

Note : Influenza ( the " flu " ) and the novel coronavirus ( COVID - 19 ) are both viruses , but different . The issue with this new virus , is it 's completely different ( and unrelated ) to the flu , which means vaccines for the flu DO NOT WORK and we have NO immunity to COVID - 19 . @USER Nope . Do vaccines against pneumonia protect you against the new coronavirus ? No . Vaccines against pneumonia , such as pneumococcal vaccine and Haemophilus influenza type B ( Hib ) vaccine , do not provide protection against the new coronavirus . #CoronaFreePakistan Do vaccines against pneumonia protect you against the new coronavirus ? No . Vaccines against pneumonia , such as pneumococcal vaccine and Haemophilus influenza type B ( Hib ) vaccine , do not provide protection against the new coronavirus . The virus is so new and different that it needs its own vaccine . Researchers are trying to develop a vaccine against 2019 - nCoV , and WHO is supporting their efforts . #CoronaFreePakistan Although these vaccines are not effective against 2019 - nCoV , vaccination against respiratory illnesses is highly recommended to protect your health . #CoronaFreePakistan

#thread :face_with_medical_mask: Should I wear a mask to protect myself ? Only wear a mask if you are ill with COVID - 19 symptoms ( especially coughing ) or looking after someone who may have COVID - 19 . If you are not ill or looking after someone who is ill then you are wasting a mask . #FightCOVID19 There is a world-wide shortage of masks , so World Health Organization urges people to use masks wisely . The most effective ways to protect yourself and others against COVID - 19 are to frequently clean your hands , cover your cough with the bend of ... #COVID19 #FightCOVID19 ... elbow or tissue and maintain a distance of at least 1 meter ( 3 feet ) from people who are coughing or sneezing . NB : You do n't need a mask if you are not a health worker , care taker , and an individual with respiratory symptoms , such as fever and cough . #FightCOVID19 It 's better to stay at home to stay safe . Good news - pvt investment is going to collapse anyway , so some headroom wud be there in savings . W / almost ALL our public debt financed locally , we have substantial fiscal policy freedom . Time to use it for Indians , instead of saving it for rating agencies Last but not least , stability of financial system has to be maintained . Tons of tools in tht kit - but the real one is simple - prevent a bank run . There is an easy soln - for the next 6 mths , nationalise ALL bank depos . MISCONCEPTIONS ABOUT CORONA VIRUS ACCORDING TO WHO Cold weather and snow CANNOT kill the new coronavirus . There is no reason to believe that cold weather can kill the new coronavirus or other diseases . The normal human body temperature remains around 36.5 ° C to 37 ° C , regardless of the external temperature or weather . The most effective way to protect yourself against the new coronavirus is by frequently cleaning your hands with alcohol-based hand rub or washing them with soap and water . Abba Kyari Buhari Abuja and Lagos #COVID-19 #Covidout Lai Mohammed

Novel Coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) advice for the public : Myth busters from the @USER Can pets at home spread the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) ? At present , there 's no evidence that companion animals / pets such as dogs or cats can be infected with the new virus . #coronavirusindia HTTPURL Does the new coronavirus affect older people , or are younger people also susceptible ? People of all ages can be infected . Older people , & people with pre-existing medical conditions ( such as asthma , diabetes , heart disease ) appear to be more vulnerable to becoming severely ill HTTPURL Are antibiotics effective in preventing and treating the new coronavirus ? No , antibiotics do not work against viruses , only bacteria . The new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) is a virus & therefore , antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment . #coronavirusindia HTTPURL Are there any specific medicines to prevent or treat the new coronavirus ? To date , there is no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat the new coronavirus ( 2019 - nCoV ) . #coronavirusindia #coronavirus HTTPURL #Coronavirus declared a public health emergency of international concern by @USER .
